question: The Government of India has imposed stock holding limits on which agricultural commodity recently?
explanation:
The Government of India has imposed stock holding limits on onion to retailers and wholesalers. This has been enforced to check onion prices and improve domestic availability of the commodity.
Government has notified that the stock holding limit would remain effective till December 31st 2020. The new system would allow stocking of onions only up to 2 tons.
